Trending Topics

Hurricane season
The Atlantic hurricane season is the period in a year from June through November when hurricanes usually form in the Atlantic Ocean. Tropical cyclones in the North Atlantic are called hurricanes, tropical storms, or tropical depressions. In 2021, the NOAA predicted between 13 and 20 named storms (those with wind speeds of 39 mph. or higher), six to 10 hurricanes (with 74 mph. winds or higher) and three to five major hurricanes (with 111 mph. winds and above). Look to see if your customer offers warranties around hurricane damage or emergency services.
Solar installations
With a rise in increasingly unpredictable/extreme weather, many homeowners are considering and turning to solar power as an alternative to traditional energy sources. U.S. solar installations increased by 46% in the first quarter of 2021. There are some businesses that solely focus on solar installations and maintenance, but it is often a service provided across a number of home service verticals. #SolarEnergy
Electricity conservation
There are many ways to reduce the use of electricity in homes during the hotter months. Common recommendations include setting your thermostat to 78 degrees or more, utilizing fans, closing blinds in windows receiving direct sunlight, and not using large appliances like dishwashers, washing machines, and ovens.
The gift of lawn care
As we move towards Mother and Father's Day season, here are seven types of people who would love lawn care as a gift: someone in need, the ameteur landscaper, the hard worker, the newbie homeowner, new parents, someone selling their home, and the person who has everything.
Keep cool this summer
Many home and business owners are looking for ways to make their HVAC systems more energy-efficient. Many HVAC customers provide energy-efficient alternatives. Check to see if your customer offers discounts on swapping to a more energy-efficient or newer model.
Learn more »
Tile Installation
Tiling contractors are great to call in for these spring home renos. They usually get discounts from tile stores and ensure spaces like showers and tubs are properly sealed to prevent future damage. Spring renovations on kitchens or bathrooms are a great opportunity to call a tiling contractor.
Home Rescue
Flooding often happens this time of the year. When homes are damaged and flooded, damage restoration crews are the folks to call. Does your customer offer warranties on their services?
Learn more »
Energy Conscious
Over the years, using solar energy in the home has not only become more popular, but more affordable. Installing solar panels in the spring is a great way to prepare for the sunny summer months.
Moving Season
Moving home from college for the summer, moving into new homes, removing clutter after spring cleaning. This time of year is big for movers. Check to see if your customer offers any spring cleaning or junk removal specials.
Work From Home Needs
As many folks have shifted to working from home, they're looking to upgrade their internet or running new lines to home offices.
Wall-To-Wall Cabinetry
Kitchens are seeing more use after the last year, filling with gadgets and tools to help with at-home meals. This year, we're seeing a shift to wall-to-wall cabinetry instead of smaller units of open shelving or cluttered countertops.
Remodeling Tip
Remodeling a home isn't for the faint of heart. It's recommended to budget a 10% cushion into your project if you're living in the home while remodeling and 30% if you plan to live elsewhere to account for delays or mishaps during construction.
Remodeling Projects
Lots of people jump into remodel-mode in the spring once the weather warms up. Contractors are needed to help plan new construction or larger remodeling projects to make sure all the right people get brought and to help estimate cost.
Home Refresh
Hiring a painting contractor is often needed for renovation projects that cover large parts of the home, high ceilings, or even where drywall has been repaired to match paint. Does your customer offer special services for repairs, or have specialty like cabinetry or exterior wall paint?
Home Reno
Whether it's installing a pool in preparation of summer or smoothing out damaged parts of the property from fallen trees and debris, if there's dirt to be moved, Excavation Contractors are here to help. Spring is the perfect time to install a swimming pool. Check to see if your customer has any specializations or specialty equipment that could help.

Folks who are building homes this spring may have the opportunity to look into customizing their driveway.

Getting ready for poolside dinners and days spent outside is the perfect opportunity to refresh outdoor living spaces — that's where our outdoor lighting customers come in. Pool lighting, advanced lighting system in gardens and yards, and professionally lit gazebos are all on the top of mind over the next few months.

Home Staging
Staging a home can drastically improve the rate at which it sells. It's important to keep in mind those carpets that have been walked on for over a decade or the rug under the dining table that doesn't get a deep clean all the time. Carpet cleaning is a great way to remove dust, dirt, build-up, and improve the air quality in a home. Some companies offer free estimates which is great for home owners working on a budget.
Learn more »
Curb Appeal
Curb appeal is a big deal when it comes to selling your home. Hiring a company to pressure wash the driveway and sidewalks of a home before it gets put on the market is an easy way to elevate the look and feel without doing any major renovation.
Learn more »
Unseen Issues in Old Homes
Older homes have their charm, but also can come with unseen issues. Depending on the age of the property, the chimney might be outdated compared to the rest of the home. An expert will know techniques to repair older and newer chimneys.
Learn more »
A Helpful Hand
Some small fixes are often needed before you close on a house. From switching light fixtures to fixing a leaky toilet, a handyman is perfect to call when there are multiple small fixes that need to get done quickly rather than calling multiple contractors.
Renovations
Smaller renovation and remodel projects may be doable on your own, but when trying to move or replace light fixtures it's important to have a professional to avoid costly mistakes.

Clean-Lined Cabinets
While trends overall are leaning away from minimalism, cabinetry is an exception. More and more homes are opting for more modern cabinets in kitchen and bathrooms instead of a more traditional style.
Pest Control in the Kitchen
Spring pests, like ants, love kitchen spaces because of the availability of potential water and food sources. Crumbs, spill residue, and food left out are some of their favorite snacks.

Mosquitoes, Ants, Fleas, Ticks, Termites, Grasshoppers, Flies, and Stinging Insects
Custom-built homes
With real estate prices in many areas going up, some people are considering custom-built homes. For many, the long-term cost savings of buying a new home are more attractive than maintaining an older home.
Pool maintenance
With summer coming, it's important to make sure your pool continues to operate successfully. Skimming, brushing, and vacuuming your pool are just a few things to keep track of when considering pool maintenance. Making sure chemical levels stay where they need to be can take a little more time and practice. Some pool companies offer routine in-person maintenance, while others may provide the perfect tools to do it yourself.
Gutter cleaning
Depending on where you live and if there are trees near your home, you need to make sure your gutters are clear of debris. Having clear gutters insures rainwater flows freely and does not get stuck which can cause standing water. This can cause a number of problems including damage to the gutter itself, excess moisture in walls, mold and mildew. Most roofing or handyman companies can safely and effectively clear gutters prior to unpredictable weather.
New construction plumbing
The housing market means an influx of new homes needing plumbing installation or updates/repairs to older plumbing in a newly-purchased home. Does your customer offer new installation warranties or discounts?
Learn more »
3D printed homes
3D printed homes are gaining popularity as they become more easily available in cities across the country. They can typically be built quickly and at a lower price than a traditional home. An interesting trend can make for a great audience participation post.
Natural mosquito control
Mosquito and other pest control using natural ingredients like plant oils are gaining in popularity. Additionally, making changes to your outdoor area like treating water features with repellent or working to remedy areas with standing water can be a big help. Mosquitoes thrive in hot, humid weather. Natural alternatives are popular because they are effective and safe for children and pets.
Drywall installation
Drywall installation is one of the most commonly requested handyman services, home improvement or to repair damage. Professionals can repair or install drywall including cracks from settling, wear and tear, moisture damage, rodent damage, drywall hanging, and painting and finishing touches.
National Water Quality Month
National Water Quality Month in August is all about protecting our water resources and educating ourselves about water quality. The average person uses approximately 80 gallons of water or more per day!
Heat wave
A heat wave is a period of excessively hot weather, which may be accompanied by high humidity, especially in oceanic climate countries. They are usually measured relative to the usual weather in a given season and area.
Forgoing a home inspection
Given a competitive housing market, some buyers are offering to forgo a home inspection when putting in an offer. While this may increase your chances of getting the home, it is generally not recommended by home inspectors or Realtors.
Learn more »
Indoor air quality
IAQ refers to the air quality within and around buildings and structures, especially as it relates to the health and comfort of building occupants. This has especially become a hot topic due to COVID-19.
Home security
Advanced technology has led the way for the creation of multiple different home security systems like Vivint, SimpliSafe, Cove, Ring, alongside established brands like ADT. While the goal is the same, different products offer different things. It's important to utilize what works best for your own home.
Lumber prices
After rising to higher than normal levels in Spring 2021, the cost of lumber has been falling since July. Wood prices have plunged back to levels resembling those before lockdowns cut supplies short and boosted demand. While this is a positive change for builders and DIY-ers, experts say not to expect the cost of new houses to decrease along with the price of lumber.
Different types of roofing
Depending on the climate where you live and budget, a certain type of roof may be more advantageous than others. If you need to repair part of your roof or re-do the entire thing, talk with your local roofing company about your options.

Clean energy
Clean energy was second-most prevalent US electricity source in 2020. Solar is the best way for common homeowners to utilize clean, renewable energy.
Learn more »
Renovating your home one room at a time
You don't have to do everything all at once. With budget and time top-of-mind, you can update your home slowly, prioritizing what's most important to you.
Learn more »
Mosquito Season
Depending on where you live, it might be peak mosquito season in your state. Ouch! Mosquitos thrive when the heather is the hottest -- here are some simple ways to help keep those pests at bay: 1) Eliminate standing water around your home. 2) Move Potted plants indoors. 3) Plant and grow insect-repellent plants, like lemon balm, mint, basil, or rosemary. 4) Hire a professional to treat your yard. If you have pets or young children, consider choosing an organic, nontoxic treatment option.
Summer comfort
Temperatures, and electricity bills, reach new heights as summer peaks and comes to a close. Here are some ways to conserve energy: 1) Replace your inefficient air conditioner. Installing new, energy-efficient models is the best way to cut costs. 2) Weatherproof your home. To ensure your cool air isn't leaking into the atmosphere, ensure that your doors and windows are sealed properly. 3). Turn off and unplug appliances when they're not in use. 8) Wash your clothes in warm or cold water rather than hot. Line dry your clothes when you can.
Learn more »
DIY vs. Ask for help
There are lots of things to consider when you're thinking about remodeling a part of your home, and perhaps the first decision to make is to whether to tackle the project alone or hire a professional. If you have comprehensive remodels in mind, it's best to entrust the job to someone who knows what they're doing. Small renovations, like refreshing paint or installing new faucets, can easily be done on our own. Always leave flooring and plumbing work to the experts.
Learn more »
Remodel your bathroom on a budget
Even if you are making the wise decision to hire outside help to complete your remodels, there are a few things you can do to keep costs down: 1) Buy your own fixtures. This ensures you get exactly what you want and you can stay within the price range you had in mind.2) Keep the existing footprint. Moving entire main fixtures, like the toilet sink or bathtub, requires expensive re-routing of water supplies, waste lines, electrical outlets, and more. Instead, consider refreshing the aesthetic instead of the arrangement. 3) Install your own mirror. The hardware to do this typically costs less than 50 dollars.Look for a professional only if the mirror is too heavy or large to take on yourself.
Laminate vs. vinyl flooring
What even is the difference? If you're concerned about the total cost or the environment, laminate is probably a better option. If you're considered about durability, moisture/water, resale value, or bet, you would benefit from choosing a luxury vinyl option. Both do look synthetic, because they are, but the final result is polished and professional.
Learn more »
Marble vs. granite
Marble and granite are both popular home renovation materials that add elegance and value to your property. Whether you’re installing a new bathroom floor or replacing your kitchen countertops, these natural stones are both great choices. If you're going for a more luxurious appearance, marble is the superior choice. It's elegant, timeless, and pairs well with a variety of aesthetic themes. If cost is on your mind, go with granite. It's cheaper than marble, comes in more color options, and still looks luxurious. Granite is easier to take care of -- it can be cleaned with mild detergent and hot water, disinfected easily, and kept stain-free with the right precautions (oil-based liquids will stain it, though). Marble, on the other hand, is more prone to staining. Granite is also stronger and will resist chipping, scratching, and cracking better than marble will. Consider choosing granite for higher-traffic areas.Both materials will and do require maintenance and occasional repair.
Learn more »
Water pressure
If you realize after testing your shower water pressure that the issue is isolated to one shower in your home, you might be able to fix the problem on your own. Here are some things to try: 1) Consider cleaning your shower aerator by soaking it in a cleaning agent like vinegar. 2) Replace your shower head with a new model. 3) Check your pipes. 4) Purchase and Install a water pressure booster. 5) Call your city's water department to ensure it's not a municipal issue.
Learn more »
Chimney Safety Week
The week before Fire Safety Week (10/3-10/9 in 2021). This observance aims to reach and teach people about chimney and venting safety.
Learn more »
National Construction Appreciation Week
This is observed during the third week in September and recognizes the dedicated, hard-working people who are instrumental in the development of our infrastructure.
Learn more »
National Fall Foliage Week
Beginning on the last Sunday in September, this week celebrates the fact that Autumn is right around the corner. Moderate temperatures, holidays, and beautiful changing leaves!
Learn more »
Types of water heaters
Conventional tank water heaters store hot water in a large tank 24 hours a day, while tankless water heaters are compact units that provide hot water as it is needed.

#MovingDay copy
Historically, June-August is peak season for moving. You can provide tips and tricks for people looking to move, even during the hectic moving season. If working with movers, here are some helpful tips: schedule at least two weeks in advance; morning time slots fill up faster; there is less demand for movers on weekdays and after Labor Day.

Common Words & Phrases

Details

Common Summer Weeds

Dallisgrass, Crabgrass, Dandelion, White Clover

Details

Adhesive

Used to bond tile to a surface.

Details

Field tile

The primary tile used to cover a wall or floor.

Details

Spacers

Plastic pieces that are used in installation to evenly space tiles.

Details

Gauge

The term used to describe the diameter of the electrical wire – the larger the number, the thinner the wire. Not to be confused with electric meters.

Details

Service Box

Main electrical panel that holds all the fuses and the more modern circuit breakers. The service box distributes electricity evenly through the house.

Details

Hardscape Elements

Walkways, Driveways, Patios, Swimming pools, Sprinkler systems, Fountains, Stone benches, Gates, Flagstone and other rocks, Arbors

Details

Softscape Elements

Grass, Trees, Shrubs, Flowers, Soil, Vegetable gardens

Details

Sump pump

A sump pump moves water from the areas surrounding a house's foundation. The main purpose of a sump pump is to pump and send water away from the house, to a place where it can cause less problems — usually a city storm drain. Properly working sump pumps are integral for homes in areas that get a lot of rain or are near sources of water.

Details

Native plants

Native plants are plants that occur naturally in a given region. They are popular in landscaping because they can more easily tolerate the area in which they are planted. They thrive in the conditions that they're used to.

Details

LED lightbulbs

LED light bulbs typically use anywhere from 25-80% less electricity and have a much longer lifespan than non-LED bulbs. Their energy consciousness and longevity continue to make them popular choices for homes and businesses.

Details

Xeriscaping

A style of landscape design requiring little or no irrigation or other maintenance, used in arid regions. Helpful for customers who offer landscaping/construction services in hot, dry areas of the country.

Details

Hardiness zone map

The U.S. hardiness zone map is the standard by which gardeners and growers can determine which plants are most likely to thrive at a given location. Learn more »

Details

Maximalism

A response to the popular trend of minimalism, maximal interior design is the next big thing. It is categorized by utilizing a combination of color, textures, and styles, and assorted items like photographs, prized collections, and eclectic furniture.

Details

Laminate flooring

Laminate flooring consists of a stack of a water-resistant base layer, that is then topped with high-density fiberboard. It's environmentally friendly because it makes use of wood waste. On top of that, there's a photgraphic print that mimics the desired look -- wood, stone, or tile. It's slicked with resin to presere it and add shine, too. It's available in different textures to provide traction or a more natural-looking finish.Oftentimes, it's the most affordable option.

Details

Luxury vinyl flooring

Luxury vinyl is entirely synthetic, consisting of multiple layers of PVC. It has a tough urethane topcoat that acts as a wear layer. Vinyl is suitable for snap-and-click, peel-and-stick, glue-down and floating installations. It's available in a variety of textures and can mimic any material, including wood and stone.

Details

Marble

Marble is a metamorphic rock. It started life as limestone and, under extreme heat and pressure, metamorphosed into marble. The primary component is calcium carbonate, which makes it comparatively soft. Marble’s characteristic veining comes from other minerals captured during the metamorphic process.Common types of marble used in renovations include: Carrara, Calacatta, Emperador, and Crema Marfil. Learn more »

Details

Granite

Granite is an igneous rock. It formed from slowly cooling magma millions of years ago. During the cooling process, mineral crystals developed, which is what gives granite its distinctive appearance. Quartz and feldspar are the dominant minerals in granite, along with mica, potassium and amphiboles, among others.It comes in colors like: white, beige, green, blue. brown, red, and black. Learn more »

Details

Subcontractors

If a contractor needs additional labor or doesn't have the expertise on hand for a certain aspect of a project, the contractor hires a subcontractor to take on a job.
